page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: The land round Spaldwick is very flat which makes it good farming land.There are a few cattle.Most of the land is now used for growing crops but there was previously some cattle.Many ponds have been filled in because they are no longer needed for cattle.The fields round Spaldwick are big.Every year more hedges are pulled out.It is a lot easier to use a combine-harvester on a big field than it is on a small field.Mr Ivorysfields vary between eight to ninetysix acres.There are two main problemsin farming,the clay soil and the drainage of water.The main crops are Rape,Wheat and Barley.Fifteen yearsago Mr Ivory grew potatoes but now he grows Rape.
